intro: Corispermum elongatum, commonly known as the slender bladdergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that are often covered in small, translucent bladders. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or saline soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
